contentrichtext.text: Three ships of the [[Royal Fleet Auxiliary]] have borne the name '''RFA ''Appleleaf''''': * [[RFA Appleleaf (1917)|RFA ''Appleleaf'']] was a [[Leaf class tanker (1916)|Leaf-class]] [[tank ship|tanker]] launched in 1916 in RFA ''Texol'', renamed RFA ''Appleleaf'' in 1917 and broken up in 1947. * [[RFA Appleleaf (A83)|RFA ''Appleleaf'' (A83)]] was a [[Leaf class tanker|Leaf-class]] tanker launched in 1955 as the ''George Lyras''. She was purchased by the RFA in 1959 and returned to her owners in 1970. * [[HMAS Westralia (O 195)|RFA ''Appleleaf'' (A79)]] was a Leaf-class tanker launched in 1975 as the ''Hudson Cavalier'' and taken into service in 1979. She was leased to the [[Royal Australian Navy]] in 1989 as [[HMAS Westralia (O 195)|HMAS ''Westralia'']], and was sold to them in 1994. {{Shipindex}} {{Italic title prefixed|3}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Appleleaf, Rfa}} [[Category:Royal Fleet Auxiliary ship names]]
